title: Formation and Transformation of Iron Oxy-hydroxide Precursor Clusters to Ferrihydrite
content:
Environ. Sci.: Nano, 2024, Accepted Manuscript
DOI: 10.1039/D3EN00930K, Paper
Alireza Namayandeh, Olaf Borkiewicz, Michel Sassi, Kevin Rosso, Marc Michel
Iron (Fe) oxy-hydroxide minerals such as ferrihydrite (Fh) are ubiquitous in Earth-surface environments and important in biogeochemical element cycling. Recent research has suggested that their formation is preceded by the...
